content: Acknowledged. The Appeal Panel determines internal appeals from decisions made by NCAT's Divisions. The role of the Appeal Panel is to hear internal appeals from decisions of each of NCAT's Divisions where there is a right of appeal to the Appeal Panel provided under the Civil and Administrative Tribunal Act 2013 (NCAT Act) or enabling legislation. The Appeal Panel is also responsible for hearing designated external appeals as provided by the NCAT Act or enabling legislation. Before proceeding with an appeal or asking for leave to appeal, parties are advised to read the NCAT Guideline on Internal Appeals and learn about making an internal appeal.
